page.title: 08HOME LIFE IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Chitterne is fairly typical of rural Wiltshire. Most wage earners have to travel some distance to work and are away from home all day. Many families own more than one car. The main meal is usually taken in the evening and often consists of a meat course such as chops or mince with potatoes and other root and green vegetables. Convenience foods such as sausages, beefburgers and frozen foods are popular especially when both adults in the family are working. Sunday roast dinner is still a highlight of the weekend and is often an occasion for all the family to get together. Leisure hours are spent gardening, walking, reading and watching television. Some people enjoy painting, needlework, knitting and other craft work.
